tags.name: Attachments
tags.description: Wiki attachments are files that can be attached to wiki pages using MD links.

tags.name: Page Moves
tags.description: Wiki page moves are operations to move wiki pages to new path or new order in the pages hierarchy.

tags.name: Pages
tags.description: Wiki pages are the MD files that are stored in a Git repository in the backend.

tags.name: Pages Batch
tags.description: Controller to handle all Batch REST calls against Wiki pages.

tags.name: Page Stats
tags.description: Controller to handle all REST calls related to  Wiki page stats.

tags.name: Wikis
tags.description: Wiki is a collection of pages maintained in a particular hierarchy. Every wiki is backed up by a Git repository.

get.description: Gets metadata or content of the wiki page for the provided path. Content negotiation is done based on the `Accept` header sent in the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: wikiIdentifier
parameters.description: Wiki ID or wiki name.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Wiki page path.

parameters.name: recursionLevel
parameters.description: Recursion level for subpages retrieval. Defaults to `None` (Optional).

values.description: Only return the specified item.
Return the specified item and its direct children.
Return the specified item and its direct children, as well as recursive chains of nested child folders that only contain a single folder.
Return specified item and all descendants

parameters.name: versionDescriptor.version
parameters.description: Version string identifier (name of tag/branch, SHA1 of commit)

parameters.name: versionDescriptor.versionOptions
parameters.description: Version options - Specify additional modifiers to version (e.g Previous)

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)

parameters.name: versionDescriptor.versionType
parameters.description: Version type (branch, tag, or commit). Determines how Id is interpreted

values.description: Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

parameters.name: includeContent
parameters.description: True to include the content of the page in the response for Json content type. Defaults to false (Optional)

200.description: Returns the wiki page in requested format.

Return the specified item and its direct children.
Return the specified item and its direct children, as well as recursive chains of nested child folders that only contain a single folder.
Return specified item and all descendants

Comment.description: Comment on an artifact like Work Item or Wiki, etc.

artifactId.description: The id of the artifact this comment belongs to

createdBy.description: IdentityRef of the creator of the comment.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the comment.

id.description: The id assigned to the comment.

isDeleted.description: Indicates if the comment has been deleted.

modifiedBy.description: IdentityRef of the user who last modified the comment.

modifiedDate.description: The last modification date of the comment.

parentId.description: The comment id of the parent comment, if any

renderedText.description: The rendered text of the comment

state.description: Indicates the current state of the comment

text.description: The plaintext/markdown version of the comment

version.description: The current version of the comment

CommentAttachment.description: Represents an attachment to a comment.

createdBy.description: IdentityRef of the creator of the attachment.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the attachment.

CommentCreateParameters.description: Represents a request to create a work item comment.

parentId.description: Optional CommentId of the parent in order to add a reply for an existing comment

comments.description: List of comments in the current batch.

continuationToken.description: A string token that can be used to retrieving next page of comments if available. Otherwise null.

count.description: The count of comments in the current batch.

nextPage.description: Uri to the next page of comments if it is available. Otherwise null.

totalCount.description: Total count of comments on a work item.

CommentMention.description: Contains information about various artifacts mentioned in the comment

artifactId.description: Id of the artifact this mention belongs to

commentId.description: Id of the comment associated with this mention. Nullable to support legacy mentions which can potentially have null commentId

mentionedArtifact.description: Value of the mentioned artifact. Expected Value varies by CommentMentionType: Person:         VSID associated with the identity Work Item:      ID of the work item Pull Request:   ID of the Pull Request

type.description: The context which represent where this mentioned was parsed from

values.description: An identity was mentioned by using the format @{VSID}
A work item was mentioned by using the format #{Work Item ID}
A Pull Request was mentioned by using the format !{PR Number}

CommentReaction.description: Contains information about comment reaction for a particular reaction type.

commentId.description: The id of the comment this reaction belongs to.

count.description: Total number of reactions for the CommentReactionType.

isCurrentUserEngaged.description: Flag to indicate if the current user has engaged on this particular EngagementType (e.g. if they liked the associated comment).

CommentResourceReference.description: Base class for comment resource references

CommentUpdateParameters.description: Represents a request to update a comment.

state.description: Set the current state of the comment

text.description: The updated text of the comment

creationDate.description: The timestamp when the repository was created.

isDisabled.description: True if the repository is disabled. False otherwise.

isFork.description: True if the repository was created as a fork.

isInMaintenance.description: True if the repository is in maintenance. False otherwise.

collection.description: Team Project Collection where this Fork resides

isFork.description: True if the repository was created as a fork

version.description: Version string identifier (name of tag/branch, SHA1 of commit)

versionOptions.description: Version options - Specify additional modifiers to version (e.g Previous)

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)

versionType.description: Version type (branch, tag, or commit). Determines how Id is interpreted

values.description: Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

Wiki.description: Defines a wiki repository which encapsulates the git repository backing the wiki.

headCommit.description: The head commit associated with the git repository backing up the wiki.

id.description: The ID of the wiki which is same as the ID of the Git repository that it is backed by.

repository.description: The git repository that backs up the wiki.

WikiAttachment.description: Defines properties for wiki attachment file.

name.description: Name of the wiki attachment file.

path.description: Path of the wiki attachment file.

WikiAttachmentResponse.description: Response contract for the Wiki Attachments API

attachment.description: Defines properties for wiki attachment file.

eTag.description: Contains the list of ETag values from the response header of the attachments API call. The first item in the list contains the version of the wiki attachment.

mappedPath.description: Folder path inside repository which is shown as Wiki. Not required for ProjectWiki type.

projectId.description: ID of the project in which the wiki is to be created.

repositoryId.description: ID of the git repository that backs up the wiki. Not required for ProjectWiki type.

values.description: Indicates that the wiki is provisioned for the team project
Indicates that the wiki is published from a git repository

projectId.description: ID of the project in which the wiki is to be created.

version.description: Version of the wiki. Not required for ProjectWiki type.

WikiPage.description: Defines a page in a wiki.

gitItemPath.description: Path of the git item corresponding to the wiki page stored in the backing Git repository.

id.description: When present, permanent identifier for the wiki page

isNonConformant.description: True if a page is non-conforming, i.e. 1) if the name doesn't match page naming standards. 2) if the page does not have a valid entry in the appropriate order file.

isParentPage.description: True if this page has subpages under its path.

order.description: Order of the wiki page, relative to other pages in the same hierarchy level.

remoteUrl.description: Remote web url to the wiki page.

subPages.description: List of subpages of the current page.

url.description: REST url for this wiki page.

WikiPageCreateOrUpdateParameters.description: Contract encapsulating parameters for the page create or update operations.

WikiPageDetail.description: Defines a page with its metedata in a wiki.

id.description: When present, permanent identifier for the wiki page

WikiPageMove.description: Request contract for Wiki Page Move.

page.description: Resultant page of this page move operation.

WikiPageMoveParameters.description: Contract encapsulating parameters for the page move operation.

newOrder.description: New order of the wiki page.

newPath.description: New path of the wiki page.

path.description: Current path of the wiki page.

WikiPageMoveResponse.description: Response contract for the Wiki Page Move API.

eTag.description: Contains the list of ETag values from the response header of the page move API call. The first item in the list contains the version of the wiki page subject to page move.

pageMove.description: Defines properties for wiki page move.

WikiPageResponse.description: Response contract for the Wiki Pages PUT, PATCH and DELETE APIs.

eTag.description: Contains the list of ETag values from the response header of the pages API call. The first item in the list contains the version of the wiki page.

WikiPagesBatchRequest.description: Contract encapsulating parameters for the pages batch.

continuationToken.description: If the list of page data returned is not complete, a continuation token to query next batch of pages is included in the response header as "x-ms-continuationtoken". Omit this parameter to get the first batch of Wiki Page Data.

pageViewsForDays.description: last N days from the current day for which page views is to be returned. It's inclusive of current day.

top.description: Total count of pages on a wiki to return.

WikiPageStat.description: Defines properties for wiki page stat.

count.description: the count of the stat for the Day

WikiPageViewStats.description: Defines properties for wiki page view stats.

collectionId.description: Collection host Id for which the wikis are updated.

projectId.description: Project Id for which the wikis are updated.

repositoryId.description: Repository Id associated with the particular wiki which is added, updated or deleted.

remoteUrl.description: Remote web url to the wiki.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.wiki: Grants the ability to read wikis, wiki pages and wiki attachments. Also grants the ability to search wiki pages.
scopes.vso.wiki_write: Grants the ability to read, create and updates wikis, wiki pages and wiki attachments.
